pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:5.1: 9. The training rule on lifted robes
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with their robes lifted up. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:7.1: “‘I will not walk in inhabited areas with my robe lifted up,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not lift one’s robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with his robe lifted on one side or both, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:10.1: The ninth training rule is finished.
